Member Function Documentation

set<uint32> GDFRef::getAllMcmIDs (  uint32  gdfFeatID  )  const
 

Returns all mcm IDs of the map, matching a single GDF ID.

Implemented for use of the MapEditor. Prints info of what GDF IDs that are found.

Parameters:
gdfFeatID Only the feature ID part of a full GDF ID.
Returns:
All matched mcm IDs.

uint32 GDFRef::getFeatCategory (  const OldItem *  item  )  const [protected]
 

Returns the feature cateory in GDF of the GDF feature corresponding to the item.

Parameters:
item The item to get GDF feature category of.
$return Returns the GDF feature category of the GDF feature corresponding to the item.

GDFID GDFRef::getGdfID (  const OldItem *  item  )  const
 

Get ID in GDF of a specific item.

Only returns one GDF ID per mcm ID (the first found). Ohter may be present.

Returns:
A GDFID object telling the GDF ID of the item.

pair< pair<uint32, uint32>, uint32> GDFRef::getGdfIDPairs (  const OldItem *  item  )  const
 

Get ID in GDF of a specific item.

Only returns one GDF ID per mcm ID (the first found). Ohter may be present.

Returns:
Returns GDF dataset, section and feature ID corresponding to the ID of item. Returns MAX_UINT32 in all fields if the item could not be found.

uint32 GDFRef::getMcmID (  pair< pair< uint32, uint32 >, uint32 >  gdfID  )  const
 

Get an mcm ID from a GDF ID.

Parameters:
gdfID The GDF id to get the mcm ID for. first.first GDF dataset frist.second GDF section second GDF feature ID
Returns:
Returns mcm ID if found, otherwise MAX_UINT32.

MC2String GDFRef::getPathAndFileName (  const OldGenericMap &  map  )  [static]
 

Returns:
Returns the path to an appropriate gdfRef file of the map supplied as an argument, or empty string if none was found.

void GDFRef::initGdfByMCM (   )  const [protected]
 

Inits the m_gdfIdByMcmId member, which is used for fast mcm ID lookup.

bool GDFRef::readGDFRefFile (  MC2String &  fileName  ) 
 

Loads the gdf ref table in fileName to this GDFRef object.

Parameters:
fileName A GDF reference file previously created by the map generation. Typically they are called *.mcm.gdf_ref.

Member Data Documentation

multimap< uint32, fullGdfID_t > GDFRef::m_gdfIdByMcmId [mutable, protected]
 

OldMaps GDF ID by mcm ID.

It is faster to look for at GDF ID in this one than it is to look in m_gdfRefTable.

Definition at line 169 of file GDFRef.h.

GDFRef::gdfRefBySection_t GDFRef::m_gdfRefTable [protected]
 

gdfRefBySection_t idsByFeatCat_t mc2IDByGdfID_t |-----------------|---| |---------|---| |-------|-------| |(dataset|section)| +-|-->| featCat | +-|--->| gdfID | mcmID | |-----------------|---| |---------|---| |-------|-------| | | | | | | | | | |-----------------|---| |---------|---| |-------|-------| | | | | | | | | | |-----------------|---| |---------|---| |-------|-------| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |

OldMaps GDF ID to mcm ID. The table is sorted on GDF dataset and section, and also GDF feature category, see figure above.
